unit: Unit 6 | Inference for Categorical Data: Proportions
title: Type II Error: Avalanche Airbag Pack
question_text: A boss was not satisfied with the survival rate of his company's avalanche airbag pack. His company redesigned their pack in the hopes of increasing the survival rate. Which of the following conditions would a Type II error be committed?

choices.text: The company concludes that the new airbag pack increases the survival rate when it actually does not increase the survival rate.
The company concludes that the new airbag pack does not increase the survival rate when it actually does increase the survival rate.
The company concludes that the new airbag pack increases the survival rate when it really does increase the survival rate.
The company concludes that the new airbag pack does not increase the survival rate when it really does not increase the survival rate.
A Type II error cannot be committed in this situation.

solution:
A Type II Error occurs when you fail to reject the null hypothesis when the null hypothesis is actually false, meaning the alternative hypothesis is true.

Explanation of Distractors Choice 'A' is incorrect as this is an example of a Type I error. A Type I error occurs when the null hypothesis is rejected when the null hypothesis is actually true. Choice 'C' is incorrect as this is an example of power. Power is the probability the null hypothesis is correctly rejected. Choice 'D is incorrect as this is an example of correctly failing to reject the null hypothesis. Choice 'E' is incorrect.
In this case:

${ H }_{ 0 }$: The survival rate with the new airbag packs is the same as the old airbag packs.
${ H }_{ a }$: The survival rate with the new airbag packs is greater than the old airbag packs.

The alternative hypothesis demonstrates an increased survival rate as this is what the company is trying to prove.

In this case the Type II error would be the company does not find any evidence that the new airbag packs increased the survival rate(fail to reject the ${ H }_{ 0 }$) when in reality the new airbag packs actually increased the survival rate(${ H }_{ a }$ is true).

Choice 'B' is the correct answer.
